snippet: As the number of children crossing the Mexican border into the United States has risen, cities and counties in Texas have passed resolutions barring immigrants from being housed there.

byline.original: By GILAD EDELMAN and TERRI LANGFORD

lead_paragraph: As the number of children crossing the Mexican border into the United States has risen, cities and counties in Texas have passed resolutions barring immigrants from being housed there.

headline.main: Some Backlash in Texas to the Housing of Children Crossing the Border
headline.print_headline: Some Backlash in Texas to the Housing of Children Crossing the Border
